message: @hameedullah We're just starting with SO for now, but we'll definitely include others. Honestly, we'd like to see which sites people want.
For stackexchange there are couple of more sites too. Programmers SE, Wordpress Answers. Shouldn't they be ocunted too?
I'd imagine ServerFault would be good to include as well... just depends on what people are asking for.
We really want to differentiate between the two.
The two being your original repos and your forks from others.

@pydanny Here's a mockup of what's coming for the profile page: https://img.skitch.com/20110630-gjcrue7x4ug7s13byb3hd34bb.jpg   The line graph would represent your commit history.  We'd love to your feedback on this.

Hey guys,

On the feature on
http://mashable.com/2011/06/30/work-for-pie/ I got great billing.
But...

The sorting of projects makes it looks like I own things that I do
not. I feel bad because people will lose credit for the projects that
they love that I just happened to fork.

Is there any way to change the sorting of projects to demonstrate
things I've made a lot of commits on, own admin rights, or am the
progenitor?
@pydanny Yes, and that's coming pretty soon.
I only see my first 100 repos. Sounds ridiculous, but I need the rest :)
Could you look to include Code Project in the sites you reference? Also if the same code on GitHub & BitBucket do you discount one of them?
Apologies for being mean on twitter last night. There is no excuse.
um, *your* point.  keyboard no work with slow brain...
@pydanny not mean at all--and you're point was quite valid.  Thanks for all the feedback--no apologies necessary. :)
@NathanGloyn we've been contacted by Code Project and will consider how that fits with everything else.
@NathanGloyn If you've got the same project mirrored on bitbucket & github, they get counted twice.  This is a bug we know about, and it'll be addressed soon.

I've had another thought. Would it be possible to include blogs and use the amount of traffic that the blog gets? you could require that people put a meta tag in the blog so that you could identify that it was their blog rather than just pointing at somebody elses.

@NathanGloyn I just want to make sure I understand... are you suggesting using the amount of traffic to your blog as another metric for your score?  That's a very interesting idea.  I'm not sure how'd we'd be able to reliably get that info, though.

@bkmontgomery apologies for not responding sooner. I know that Google analytics provides the ability to allow other people to access stats on your site and its likely that wordpress and blogger will provide similar functionality. Of course there is the possibility that somebody could game the system but no method is perfect.
suggestion: maybe show what each independent thing scores, so you know what makes up most of your score so you can work on things that don't help your score so much

@italiano40 We agree!  We're adding that functionality in the next version of our profiles.  So there will be a "your score" section that shows your overall score, and then how well you're doing on three elements - code (GH and BB), community (HN), and Q&A (SO).  We should have the mockups of this section done in a day or two, and when they are we'll post them.  :)
@italiano40 as promised: http://yfrog.com/kiq9dp
@cliffmckinney looks awesome can't wait to have it on my profile!
Are you guys planning on ever introducing google code as part of the pie score?

@italiano40 firstly, sorry for the late reply.  Lots of people have asked for google code support, and we do plan on adding support for that (and possibly other code-hosting sites). However, we've got several other features that we're working on first.
@italiano40 However, I promise we're working as quickly as we possibly can!  ;)
@bkmontgomery np all sounds good!
Hi folks!  We gave the profiles a major facelift today, so if you haven't already I encourage you to go check them out!  Thanks in advance. :)

@cliffmckinney there is a bug the label is very offset from the cursor, http://i.imgur.com/DRGVi.png i am on mac OSX 10.5.8 FireFox 5.0.1 and it would be cool to also either have the projects sort by top watchers or most recent push or what you want to feature b/c one of my project that i don't maintain anymore is the first thing seen :( but it looks so cool, def put this on my about.me page removing just a bunch of links to my github and hackernews LOL
Will you be adding linkedIn support? I've already filled in my profile on LinkedIn with education, jobs etc so don't really want to do it again
@NathanGloyn lots of people have asked for this, so it's probably something we'll add, but unfortunately I don't know when this might happen.

@italiano40 thanks for the tip about the label. Also, we do plan to add tools that let you sort repos, as well as tools that let you set the default ordering on your profile. Those should both come in the next couple of weeks.
